review: It's not always flawless but when it works it's quite handy. The only real downside is that it requires external power but that's not a big deal.Streams from various Chromecast apps but just Youtube alone is already a nice experience. Maybe you're getting what you paid for but the experience is well beyond $35.
author: Jeff Chuang

review: This device works very well at what it does.  It needs more sources than You Tube and Netflix, and the tab mirroring from the Chrome browser lags a bit.  But for playing Netflix, or a You Tube video, the performance is great.Controlling the Netflix player is something else, as it requires using the Netflix app.  From my Android phone, the Netflix app seems to often forget that it's playing via Chromecast, and has to reconnect.  On my MacBook, Netflix wanted to install "Silverlight", which is pretty ridiculous for a remote control (all that I want it to do).Bottom line: worth the price for now, may mature into a fantastic product.

review: I was one of those that bought this within minutes of it showing up on Amazon on launch day. I can't say for sure if I would have done that without the three months of Netflix, but I'm glad I did go ahead with the purchase. While the uses are very limited today, if the companies that have promised support for the Chromecast follow through, I imagine I'll change this to 5/5 instead of 4/5. Setup was easy, and using it is simple. It's inexpensive, and extremely portable. I may end up buying another to keep plugged into the second TV later on.
